intro: Psychotria hidalgensis, commonly known as the Hidalgo psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico, specifically the state of Hidalgo, where it grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in shaded, forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soil. Psychotria hidalgensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
